intro: Stachyandra imberbis, commonly known as the hairless stachyandra, is a member of the Iridaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to South Africa. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces delicate, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with a subtle fragrance. Stachyandra imberbis is often grown in rock gardens or as a container plant due to its compact size and ornamental appeal.
